availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Bazor DeSpain. Father of Mary DeSpain, Joseph DeSpain, John DeSpain, Jr., William DeSpain, Nancy DeSpain, Sarah DeSpain, Robert DeSpain, Fielding DeSpain, Lewis DeSpain, Edward DeSpain, Elizabeth DeSpain, Araminta DeSpain, and Martha "Patsy" DeSpain. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 144A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 694.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Upper Brush Creek Precinct, p. 513A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 16317.
"John DeSpain (1806-1866)," Find A Grave, Memorial 120373712, accessed March 24, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120373712.
